steps.title: Go to https://www.icloud.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.icloud.com/ in a web browser. You can access your iCloud account on any modern browser, including Opera and Internet Explorer.

steps.title: Enter your Apple ID email address and password.
steps.content: Enter your Apple ID email address and password. These are the credentials you'll use to sign into the App Store. If you don't have an Apple ID, first create one.

steps.title: Click Numbers.
steps.content: Click Numbers. It's a green app with white bars on it.

steps.title: Open your Numbers document.
steps.content: Open your Numbers document. If it's in iCloud, it will appear on the Numbers page. If you have to upload the document from your desktop: click the green gear icon, click Upload a Spreadsheet , and select your Numbers document.

steps.title: Click the wrench icon.
steps.content: Click the wrench icon. It's in the top-right side of the document's page.

steps.title: Click Download a Copy.
steps.content: Click Download a Copy . This is the top option in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Excel.
steps.content: Click Excel . It's on the right side of the Download a Copy window. Doing so will prompt a .xls version of the Numbers file to download onto your computer.

steps.title: Make sure your Numbers document is open.
steps.content: Make sure your Numbers document is open. You should see the "Numbers" heading in the top-left corner of the Mac menu bar.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . It's in the top-left area of your Mac's screen. Doing so will invoke a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select Export To.
steps.content: Select Export To . This option is near the middle of the File drop-down menu. Selecting it invokes a pop-out menu.

steps.title: Click Excel.
steps.content: Click Excel . It's in the Export To pop-out menu.

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next . It's in the bottom-right corner of the "Export Your Spreadsheet" window.

steps.title: Enter a name for your file.
steps.content: Enter a name for your file. This is how your file will appear in both Numbers and Excel.

steps.title: Select a save location.
steps.content: Select a save location. You'll do so by clicking a folder (e.g., "Desktop").

steps.title: Click Export.
steps.content: Click Export . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. This will save your Numbers document as an Excel document. You can double-click the document on any computer with Excel installed to open it in Excel.

steps.title: Go to CloudConvert's website.
steps.content: Go to CloudConvert's website. It's at https://cloudconvert.com/numbers-to-xlsx . While there isn't a native way to change a Numbers document to an Excel document in Windows, you can use CloudConvert's services to make the conversion.

steps.title: Click Select Files.
steps.content: Click Select Files . This button is near the top of the page. Doing so will open a file selection window.

steps.title: Select the Numbers file.
steps.content: Select the Numbers file. The file selection window will likely open to your desktop folder, so if the Numbers file isn't there, you'll first have to select the Numbers file's location from the left-hand sidebar.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . Doing so will upload the Numbers file to CloudConvert's website.

steps.title: Click select format.
steps.content: Click select format . It's near the top of the page. Doing so will prompt a drop-down menu. The select format bar may already say ".xls" or ".xlsx", in which case you can skip the next two steps.

steps.title: Select Spreadsheet.
steps.content: Select Spreadsheet . It's at the bottom of the "file selection" drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click xls or xlsx.
steps.content: Click xls or xlsx . XLS pertains to older versions of Excel documents, while XLSX documents are formatted for newer versions of Excel.

steps.title: Click Start Conversion.
steps.content: Click Start Conversion . It's the red button in the bottom-right corner of the page. This will convert your Numbers document into your selected Excel document format.

steps.title: Click Download.
steps.content: Click Download . This green button is in the upper-right area of the site's page. Doing so will download your converted document in Excel format. You can double-click the newly converted Excel document to open it in Excel, provided your computer has Excel installed.

steps.title: Open Numbers.
steps.content: Open Numbers. This is the green app with white bars on it.

steps.title: Select a document to open.
steps.content: Select a document to open. You may first have to tap the "Back" button in the top-left corner of the screen if Numbers opens to an existing document.

steps.title: Tap ….
steps.content: Tap … . It's in the top-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Export.
steps.content: Tap Export . This option is near the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Excel.
steps.content: Tap Excel . It's the lower-left option on this page.

steps.title: Tap Mail.
steps.content: Tap Mail . You'll see the mail icon, which resembles a white envelope on a light-blue background, in the top row of the pop-up menu that's at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Enter your email address.
steps.content: Enter your email address. This should go in the "To" field, which is at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Send.
steps.content: Tap Send . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. Doing so will send the Numbers document in .XLS format to your email inbox, from which you can download it to a computer that uses Excel.
